title: Process of Performing Intensive Devotional Service | Sri Vasudeva Keshav Dasa | SB 6.9.28-30
speaker: HG Vasudev Keshav Dasa

segments.key_quote: Surrounding and serving the Supreme Personality of Godhead, Narayana, were sixteen personal attendants, decorated with ornaments and appearing exactly like Him, but without the mark of Sri Vatsa and the Kaustubha jewel.
segments.summary: The speaker reads and translates verses from Srimad Bhagavatam describing the appearance of Lord Hari and Narayana along with sixteen attendants after the demigods offer prayers.

segments.key_quote: So in this chapter, Appearance of Demon Vritrasura, in just a few verses before, we saw how the demon Vritrasura appeared and under what conditions he appeared.
segments.summary: The speaker provides context to the verses by summarizing the events leading to the Lord's appearance, including the appearance of Vritrasura and the demigods' prayers.

segments.key_quote: He appeared first within their hearts and then He appeared before them. This was the process of appearance.
segments.summary: The speaker explains the process of the Lord's appearance, first in the heart and then externally, drawing parallels with Krishna's appearance to Devaki and Dhruva Maharaja's experience.

segments.key_quote: Here also the Lord has appeared with 16 more personal attendants. And there is only one difference between the Lord's appearance and the appearance of these 16 attendants.
segments.summary: The speaker describes the Lord's appearance with attendants, highlighting the distinguishing features of the Lord (Srivatsa and Kaustubha gem) and the demigods' overwhelming happiness and subsequent prayers.

segments.key_quote: If one is chanting the Hare Krishna mantra very sincerely, very attentively then the Lord will appear in front of the devotee.
segments.summary: The speaker emphasizes that the Lord becomes visible through sincere chanting and extraordinary bhakti, highlighting that the entire Bhagavatam is a scripture of pure bhakti.

segments.key_quote: Dhruva, although he had a heart with you know he had some material desires but he took to the practice of devotional service that his spiritual master gave him very very seriously.
segments.summary: The speaker uses the examples of Dhruva and Prahlad Maharaj to illustrate the power of serious devotional service, emphasizing that the Lord appears to those engaged in pure bhakti.

segments.key_quote: Therefore persons whose minds are fixed on the Lord engage in intensive practice of devotional service that is the only means for attainment of the final perfection of life.
segments.summary: The speaker quotes Lord Kapila's teachings to Devahuti, emphasizing that intensive practice of devotional service (Tivrena Bhakti Yogena) is the only means to attain the final perfection of life.

segments.key_quote: Bali Maharaj was not thinking okay if I give away everything the Lord will bless me so let me give away no he did not have any of those calculations he just gave everything to the Lord because he knows finally everything belongs to the Lord and for complete surrender to the Lord
segments.summary: The speaker uses the examples of Bali Maharaj and Sudama to further illustrate intense devotional service, highlighting their selfless surrender and devotion to the Lord.

segments.key_quote: He said I want your achala bhakti achala bhakti so this is what his ask was achala bhakti means achala means which moves which shakes achala bhakti means which is unshakable devotion
segments.summary: The speaker narrates the story of the florist Sudama, who asked for achala bhakti (unshakable devotion) from Lord Krishna, emphasizing the importance of unwavering faith.

segments.key_quote: I should serve all your devotees eternally and then because the Lord saw that he could have asked so many material things but his bhakti was unshakable and he asks I just want to be your servant and serve your devotees the Lord was so pleased
segments.summary: The speaker continues the story of the florist Sudama, highlighting his desire to serve the Lord's devotees and the blessings he received as a result of his pure devotion.

segments.key_quote: What is this intense practice of devotional service it's called ahaitukim bhakti achala bhakti ahaitukim bhakti ahaitukim bhakti means causeless devotional service or unalloyed devotional service means our bhakti to the Lord should not be mixed with anything
segments.summary: The speaker introduces the concept of ahaituki bhakti (causeless or unalloyed devotion) from the Atmarama verse, emphasizing that devotion should be free from material desires or motivations.

segments.key_quote: You all should perform amalaya bhaktia amalaya bhakti see the teachings of the Bhagavatam even a small child teaching to small children pure devotional service he is not just teaching bhakti he is teaching amalaya bhakti and Prabhupada translates this amalaya bhakti as spotless devotional service
segments.summary: The speaker discusses Prahlad Maharaj's teachings on amalaya bhakti (spotless devotional service) to his demoniac friends, emphasizing that the Lord is pleased only by unflinching, unalloyed devotion.

segments.key_quote: Thus the devotees who worship me the all pervading lord of the universe in unflinching devotional service gives up all aspirations to be promoted to the heavenly planets or to become happy in this world with wealth children cattle home or anything in relationship with the body i take him to the other side of birth and death
segments.summary: The speaker returns to Lord Kapila's teachings, introducing ananya bhakti (unflinching devotional service) and explaining that those who worship the Lord without material aspirations are taken beyond birth and death.

segments.key_quote: Avyabhicharena bhakti, will make the Lord appear. Avyabhicharena bhakti yogena. Avyabhicharena means no deviation, not thinking this, thinking that, just pure devotion fixed on the Lord, mind fixed on the Lord.
segments.summary: The speaker emphasizes the importance of pure devotional service, referencing the Bhagavad Gita and the concept of avyabhicharena bhakti (devotion without deviation), where the mind is fixed on the Lord.

segments.key_quote: Prabhupada had that pure devotional service in his heart, he was constantly meditating and this is what he wanted to give to the world. Pure devotional service, pure bhakti.
segments.summary: The speaker highlights Srila Prabhupada's pure devotional service and his desire to give it to the world, emphasizing that the spiritual master possesses and bestows this pure devotion.

segments.key_quote: Sri Siddhanta Saraswati, He is very dear to Satchi Sutta, to Chaitanya Mahaprabhu. Krishna Shevaya Jara Tula Naya and there is no comparison of the kind of devotional service that he is performing to Krishna Seva.
segments.summary: The speaker quotes a prayer by Srila Prabhupada to Srila Bhaktisiddhanta Saraswati Thakur, emphasizing his intense devotion and his role in bestowing Krishna bhakti throughout the world.

segments.key_quote: He has given us pure devotional service to Krishna and he has taught us if we also engage like this, you will be able to see Krishna one day.
segments.summary: The speaker reiterates that Srila Prabhupada has given us pure devotional service and taught us how to see Krishna by following the process he has given.

segments.key_quote: One should not artificially try to see the form of the Lord while chanting Hare Krishna. But when the chanting is performed offenselessly, the Lord will automatically reveal himself to the view of the chanter.
segments.summary: The speaker emphasizes the importance of believing in Srila Prabhupada's words and following his instructions, quoting Prabhupada on how the Lord will automatically reveal himself through offenseless chanting.

segments.key_quote: This sincere attitude will make you more and more advanced and one day Krishna will reveal himself to you face to face.
segments.summary: The speaker quotes a letter from Srila Prabhupada, emphasizing the importance of maintaining principles, chanting 16 rounds, and cultivating a sincere attitude, which will lead to Krishna revealing himself face to face.
